result.execSummary:
The defendant Samantha L Loomans was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.
Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or education.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall have no contact with Kolten Yenter unless approved by probation agent.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant shall have no contact with persons known to be illegally using, possessing or selling controlled substances.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge.
Defendant shall take all medications as prescribed.
Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall advise any medical provider of her opiate addiction prior to being prescribed any medications.

timeConds.notes: Commencing forthwith.  Time shall be served with Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

supervisions.notes:
Commencing forthwith.  
Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program and the Substance Abuse Program only after serving 18 months of confinement.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant shall obtain/maintain full-time employment or schooling.
Defendant shall submit to random drug screens including blood, breath or urine.

Defendant shall have no contact with the co-defendant, Kolten Yenter.  
Defendant shall not possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  
Defendant shall not be present in any place where controlled substances are illegally purchased, stored or sold.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant shall notify any medical or healthcare provider of opiate addiction prior to obtaining a prescription.
Any outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from prison funds at a rate to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections and the balance shall be due as a condition of Extended Supervision or judgment shall be entered for nonpayment.
